questions.question_text: What allows endpoints behind a NAT to discover the paths through which they will pass media?

comments.content: Where is All Cisco dumps? I can't find them
Where is Cisco 300-820 questions ? I don't see it here anymore. Only in discussions.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
ICE makes use of Traversal Using Relay NAT (TURN) and Session Traversal Utilities for NAT (STUN) to optimize the media path of MRA calls.

 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/PA/ICE/icepa125.html

questions.question_text: Which option mandates that calls fall back to unencrypted media if encryption cannot be established?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"Best effort" means the system will try to establish encryption, but if it fails, it will proceed with the call unencrypted. This is the most flexible option, allowing for encrypted communication when possible while still enabling communication even if encryption fails.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A company has a Cisco collaboration infrastructure that contains Cisco UCM and Cisco Expressway-C and Expressway-E for Mobile and Remote Access. When the engineer sets up the environment to support B2B calling, they discover that the zone stale between Expressway-C and Cisco UCM failed. What must the STEP Trunk Security Profile setting be changed to in Cisco UCM to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C: We always look after to "incoming port", since CUCM device listens to 5060/5061 TCP and 5061 TLS to avoid overlapping.

Selected Answer: B
Answer B?: The issue between Expressway-C and CUCM is likely related to the SIP trunk configuration and its associated Security Profile settings. Specifically, this problem often arises when there is a port mismatch between the Expressway and Cisco UCM.

When configuring a SIP trunk for B2B (Business-to-Business) calling, the STEP (SIP Trunk Security Profile) must be properly set up to ensure the correct port and transport settings are used. The SIP trunk may not be able to establish a successful connection if there is a conflict with the default listening port or if there is a need for a non-default port for outgoing SIP connections on Cisco UCM.

choices.C: value other than the default listening port for incoming SIP connections on Cisco UCM
choices.B: value other than the default listening port for outgoing SIP connections on Cisco UCM
choices.A: UDP for the outgoing transport type
choices.D: TCP for the incoming transport type

questions.question_text: In a Webex Video Mesh deployment, where do Cloud-registered Webex Teams clients and devices send signaling traffic for call setup?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer B: In a Webex Video Mesh deployment, Cloud-registered Webex Teams clients and devices send their signaling traffic directly to the Webex cloud for call setup, even if a Video Mesh node is involved in the media plane for the call.

choices.D: to a remote Video Mesh node
choices.A: to a local Video Mesh node

choices.D: Go to Configuration > Unified Communications > MRA > HTTP allow list > Editable inbound rules to view, create, modify, or delete HTTP allow list rules.
choices.C: Go to Configuration > MRA > Editable Inbound rules to view, create, modify, or delete HTTP allow list rules.
choices.A: Go to Configuration > Unified Communications > HTTP allow list > Editable inbound rules to view.
choices.B: Go to Configuration > MRA > HTTP allow rules > Editable inbound rules to view, create, modify, or delete HTTP allow list rules.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
From the 'Configuration' dropdown you can select Unified Communications>HTTP Allow List>Editable inbound rules
B&C are wrong because there is no 'MRA' option from the 'Configuration' menu dropdown
D is wrong because there is no 'MRA' option after selecting 'Unified Communications' from the 'Configuration' menu dropdown.

questions.question_text: A new set of Expressway-C and Expressway-E is deployed and was configured for Mobile and Remote Access with basic settings. How must the engineer edit the inbound allow list rule?
